main event: A UFO sighting was reported in Poughkeepsie, New York on 2nd October 1955 at 11:10 PM. The object was observed to be brighter than a shooting star, had an ill-defined contour, and displayed a parallel drop followed by a sudden increase in velocity to 350 mph. The witness filled out a detailed questionnaire about the sighting.
interesting points: The object was described as being brighter than a shooting star and displayed an ill-defined contour.
It was reported to have a parallel drop for 10 seconds and then suddenly accelerated to a velocity of 350 mph.
The witness was located outdoors and noticed the object while lying in bed, resting.
The witness produced a hand-drawn sketch of the object, describing it as a luminous, round shape and completed a detailed questionnaire about the sighting events.
The witness reported that the airspeed indicator on their aircraft went off scale during a part of the sighting, but the cause was unknown.
result: Though initially categorized as possibly a balloon or an aircraft, the object remained unexplained
sighted object: Luminous object brighter than a shooting star
witnesses: Civilian pilot and other unidentified observers
